channel.title: Tomas Ondrias
channel.description: Tomas Ondrias is a graduate of opera singing at the Academy of Performing Arts in Bratislava. He worked with Opernfestspielen St. Margarethen (2012), Operettenfestspielen Bad Hall (2014) under the baton of conductors as Alfred Eschwé, Gustav Kuhn and Gergard Lagrange. While studying at the Academy of Performing Arts he is presented within opera studies as Don Asdrubale and Pulcherio in Mozart's opera Lo Sposo Deluso. He interprets classic songs, opera, operetta and pop opera (operatic pop). As a soloist he sings in vocal-instrumental ensemble Cavalieri, which is mainly devoted to the interpretation of the operetta genre in its specific arrangement. As a soloist he regularly participates in the Slovak National Song Festival, organized by the Matica Slovenská. Tomas Ondrias is an active performer and singer at many events in Slovakia and abroad.
